feed.title: A Method for Computing Merkle Roots of Annotated Binary Trees

entry.title: A Method for Computing Merkle Roots of Annotated Binary Trees
entry.summary: In this email conversation, Russell O'Connor and Peter Todd discuss the math operations used in creating a Merkle Root. O'Connor uses the symbol "⋅" to represent concatenation and the symbol "×" to mean the Cartesian product. However, Todd asks for clarification on what specifically O'Connor means by Cartesian product. The conversation ends with Todd's signature and a digital signature attachment.
